messages.text: Good morning! Just wanted to share that my crypto mining pool gave me a 12% return this week. Hope your day is going well! â˜•
By the way, how's your work project going? The one you mentioned was stressing you out last week.

redFlags.text: Sharing specific investment returns without being asked
redFlags.explanation: Scammers casually mention high returns to create interest in their investment scheme.

redFlags.text: Mentions unusually high returns (12% in one week)
redFlags.explanation: Consistent weekly returns of this magnitude are extremely rare and typically unrealistic.

redFlags.text: Follows up with personal question to maintain relationship
redFlags.explanation: Pig butchering scammers balance investment talk with personal connection to build trust.

options.text: This is a legitimate message from a friend who's into investments
options.feedback: This is actually part of a pig butchering scam. The casual mention of high returns followed by personal questions is a technique to build trust while planting investment ideas.

options.text: This is part of a sophisticated scam attempt
options.feedback: Correct! This shows the trust-building phase of a pig butchering scam, where the scammer balances personal conversation with mentions of high-return investments.

options.text: Reply about your work, then ask more about their investment
options.feedback: This is exactly what the scammer wants - showing interest in their investment while continuing the personal relationship development.

options.text: Reply only about your work situation, ignoring the investment mention
options.feedback: While safer than asking about investments, continuing personal conversation still keeps the relationship going, which is part of the scammer's strategy.

options.text: Ask direct questions about the legitimacy of their investment claims
options.feedback: Scammers are prepared for skepticism and have convincing responses ready. Engaging at all keeps you in their process.

options.text: Stop responding and block the contact
options.feedback: Excellent choice! Once you recognize the pattern of casual investment mentions and personal connection building, disengaging completely is the safest response.
